Reviews.Title: A good, basic, simple phone
Reviews.Author: cincyblue
Reviews.Content: I just recently bought the Nokia 111 to replace an older Nokia flip phone. I wanted something basic and simple, as I don't text, I don't access the Internet on my phone and I don't Facebook or Tweet. The Nokia 111 fulfills my needs very nicely. It's compact and light and has a decent screen. Working through the menus is easy. Locking and unlocking the keypad is simple. I recommend it to anyone wanting a good, basic, simple phone.

Reviews.Title: Can't use with ATT anymore
Reviews.Author: xin hu
Reviews.Content: I had to return it because ATT said this phone is 2G, and their network no longer support this type of devices.The phone feels ok in hand.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Vasileios Pananidis
Reviews.Content: Best value for money. Too much SAR. It is best buy in terms of money. Better than I expected. Convenient.

Reviews.Title: ****The Phone is not Unlocked****Never buy from this seller*****
Reviews.Author: Sree
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my elderly parents to use in India. It displays  a message "call not allowed" when tried placing calls using multiple sim cards.(various providers)The battery is not even lasting for a day after a full charge(with no calls made).Looks like I need to spend more money to unlock it....Unable to return the phone since it is already sent to India.

Reviews.Title: problems with AT&T; data connect
Reviews.Author: C. Cheshier "chessucat"
Reviews.Content: This phone will AT&T; voice, but will not recognise the data connect.  I tried setting the Connectivity Packet data to wap.cingular that my previous Nokia 2600 use to access web content, but it can't reach the server right now.  Please check your connection and try again (006).
